breweries.name: Lassen Ale Works
breweries.description: Northeast California's only brewpub-- Lassen Ale Works--  Located in uptown Susanville, CA at the historic Pioneer Saloon.  21 and over only, ID required. On-site brewery.  Six house beers on draft, plus seasonal specialties and guest taps.  Full bar offers good selection of wine by the glass and craft cocktails, single malt scotch and premium liquors. Fine pub fare is prepared in house, from scratch. House specialties include beer battered fish with hand cut chips, lamb dip and fresh salads. Weekend lunch and dinner specials. Pool tables.

data.name: Pipe Dreams Porter
data.description: Chocolate maltiness dominates the flavor of this dark ale.  It’s big body and mellow hop profile results in a thick, satisfying porter that’s sure to please.  Put this in your pipe and smoke it!

breweries.name: Mother Earth Brew Company
breweries.description:
In early 2010, Mother Earth launched a unique brewing supply store and tasting room at its new Vista, CA location. Just a half mile from the 78 freeway and just minutes from the I-5, Mother Earth Brew Co. is right in the middle of the "North County Beer Triangle" in North San Diego County. 

Our business caters to home brewers seeking the highest quality, freshest ingredients and to people who enjoy sampling great beers - many of which are exclusively available at our tasting bar! Come on by for a truly unique experience, and always remember...Love Your Mother!

data.name: Pipeline Porter
data.description: Pipeline Porter is smooth and dark with a distinctive roasty aroma and earthy complexity from its diverse blends of premium malted barley. This celebration of malt unites with freshly roasted 100% Kona coffee grown at Cornwell Estate on Hawaii’s Big Island, lending a unique roasted aroma and flavor. A delicate blend of hops rounds out this palate-pleasing brew.

breweries.name: Kona Brewing Company
breweries.description: Kona Brewing Company was started by father and son team Cameron Healy and Spoon Khalsa. The pair had a dream to create fresh, local island brews made with spirit, passion and quality. Their love of Hawaii, and a desire to protect the pristine environment here, brought them to the Big Island to fulfill their vision. Kona Brewing continues to be headquartered right where it began, in Kailua-Kona on Hawaii's Big Island.

breweries.name: Blackjack Brewing Company
breweries.description:
HAND CRAFTED BEER OF THE FINEST QUALITY

Blackjack is a local craft brewery focused on making excellent small batch beers and serving them in a relaxed, communal environment.
It was started by Ed Wenda, a Raleigh native and former dentist, who one day realized he enjoys brewing beer more than drilling on teeth.  Ed also brought in Brooks Hamaker to brew beer.  Brooks has 29 years brewing experience, starting with more than a decade of being the head brewer at Abita Brewing Co.  Brooks has also brewed for Fullsteam and Big Boss breweries.  Also behind the scenes is Tim Sullivan, formerly of Big Boss Brewing.  Tim is Mr. “Fix It” who does everything from cellar work at the brewery to fixing our old skeeball machine.

data.name: Pistolero
data.description: Just like a gunslinger, Pistolero Porter is complex, smooth and robust. Its an enjoyable brew that only intensifies as it warms. A mild hop bitterness up front enhances the roasted and chocolate finish.

breweries.name: Payette Brewing Co
breweries.description:
Our brewery currently runs a 15-barrel brewing system and offers four year-round beers: Payette Pale Ale, Outlaw IPA, Mutton Buster Brown Ale and North Fork Lager. In 2012, we made Idaho brewing history when we introduced Payette Pale Ale and Mutton Buster in cans. Be on the lookout for even more choices of canned beer in the future. In the meantime, you can find our beer in bars, restaurants, and retail locations including grocery and specialty stores throughout Idaho.

We chose the name Payette because it fits the way we live and work. Francois Payette was a French Canadian trapper whose name and memory is enshrined among numerous Idaho landmarks. The name has since become synonymous with an adventurous spirit that pervades Idaho's year-round outdoor lifestyle.

breweries.name: Snowshoe Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Snowshoe Brewing Co. was founded in early 1995, with a mission to brew great beer and create a diverse menu of good food. Our brewpub & restaurant was opened in Arnold, Calaveras County, in the former location of The Meadowmont Inn, overlooking the golf course. 

Our brewers have created award-winning ales that have ale lovers throughout Central California and the Sierras asking for a Snowshoe at their favorite pubs and restaurants. The staff at our restaurant wants to ensure that your meal is enjoyable… served with our Snowshoe hospitality!

The beer is bottled in Calaveras and brewed using a 15-barrel brewhouse, three 15-barrel fermenters and three 30-barrel fermenters. Our specialty beers include India Pale Ale, Westridge Winter Ale, Cutthroat Strong Ale, Oktoberfest, Irish Red, Porter, Midnight Moon Oatmeal Stout.

data.name: Pitmaster Porter
data.description: A sweet, malty, dark ale. Brewed with roasted barley, and a variety of dark malts, this full-bodied beer has aromas and flavors of toffee, chocolate, and coffee.

breweries.name: Kilowatt Brewing
breweries.description:
Kilowatt Brewing produces unique styled, hand-crafted beer located in the Kearny Mesa neighborhood. Creative and interactive lighting permeates throughout the brewery and taproom featuring rotating artwork created by local artists. Custom programmed LED lighting allows us to change the lighting color and mood in real-time while our customers enjoy Kilowatt’s unique beer styles in a one-of-a-kind taproom.

Kilowatt rotates in outside chefs and gourmet food trucks providing different styles of food and menus daily, while allowing you to experience select culinary items paired with complimentary styles of beer. For example an Asian style food truck will pair unique menu items with Kilowatt’s Green Tea Ale, Coconut Chai Porter, or Goji Berry Mountain Honey Ale.

Hop flavor and aroma may vary from being negligible to medium in character.

breweries.name: Blue Corn Brewery
breweries.description: Blue Corn Brewery is a mid sized brewpub in Santa Fe New Mexico. All the beer at Blue Corn is brewed on a one manned 7 barrel brew house. There are four 7 barrel fermenters and one 15 barrel fermenter. The 15 barrel is used exclusively for the Road Runner IPA, our most popular beer. Our Head Brewer, John Bullard uses the finest ingredients from around the world to make a wide variety of ales and lagers. Blue Corn Brewery has 6 house beers and 4 rotating specialty beers. Blue Corn Brewery also specializes in Northern New Mexican cuisine.

style.name: Brown Porter

breweries.name: Old Forge Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Old Forge Brewing Company is a fun, casual, comfortable brewpub, specializing in healthy pub fare and fresh brewed beer.

Our country was built on the skills and labor of old-world artisanal craftsmen. Woodworkers, carpenters, stonemasons, ironworkers, blacksmiths, tileworkers, and many others came here and employed the knowledge and skills of their craft in building their farms, homes, and towns.

Nowadays, it is so easy and convenient to purchase generic products from big-box stores, that we sometimes neglect to appreciate the uniqueness and quality of a hand-crafted product.

At Old Forge Brewing Company, we strive to honor personal craftsmanship. Our hand-crafted beer is made in small batches to ensure quality and peak freshness, while the healthy and delicious menu has ingredients sourced from local farms and markets wherever possible. Take the time to notice our bar, furniture, and fixtures which were all handcrafted by local wood and metal worker Keith Kocher (Lightstreet Custom Woodworking). Check out our unique tap handles carved and forged by local artist/sculptor J. Mark Irwin (Irwin Sculpture Studio), and our plates, bowls, and beer mugs, all hand-made by local potter Mike Hart (M. Hart Pottery).

data.name: Pluff Mud Porter
data.description:
2012 GABF Gold Medal

Pluff mud [plŭff-mŭd], noun, A mixture of dirt and water indigenous to the marshes of the South Carolina Lowcountry, with a distinct odor that’s endearing to locals, but off-putting to tourists and redcoats.

Our second flagship beer was an effort to bring the American Porter style to the Charleston market proper, while also making a beer that stays appealing as the mercury rises. We think we’ve succeeded in Pluff Mud Porter. It presents (and smells) like a classic porter, with subtle chocolate notes and a silky finish, but the medium body and tame ABV keep it refreshing at all times. Enjoy this throughout the year, in or out of the marsh.

Pluff Mud makes its way into bourbon barrels roughly once a year. Keep your eyes (and nostrils) peeled.

breweries.name: Atomic Ale Brewpub and Eatery
breweries.description: Founded by Aaron Burks in 1997, Atomic Ale Brewpub & Eatery is the Tri-Cities’ first brewpub. We feature a distinctive menu cooked in the Tri-Cities’ original wood-fired oven to complement our fresh, full-flavored handcrafted ales. Set in an atmosphere that reflects the rich history of the Mid-Columbia basin and the Hanford Site, we work hard to provide an exceptional dining experience.

data.name: pms Smoked Molasses Porter
data.description: (Peated, Smoked, Molasses) Porters are dark,, chocolaty beers and first cousins to Stout. We used some molasses in the boil to add some depth of character and then smoked a small portion of the grain over a peat fire to give it a slight smokiness as well. Don’t let the color fool you, this is a very drinkable beer.

breweries.name: 5 Seasons Brewing Company
breweries.description: 5 Seasons Brewing is passionate about serving local produce, all-natural meats, and artisanal cheeses. We believe in conserving the spirit of the farm and supporting local farmers. We are also acknowledged as the center of Atlanta’s beer culture.

data.name: Poe Paddy Porter
data.description: Named for our beloved State Park this Robust Porter draws its uniquely enticing roasted character from a thoughtful combination of malts. Generous hop additions ensure a satisfying beer drinking experience.

breweries.name: Elk Creek Cafe and Aleworks
breweries.description: Head Brewer Tim Yarrington makes beers that people want to drink.  With over 12 years brewing experience under his belt, founding the brewery operations at Long Valley Pub & Brewery in New Jersey and resurrecting Time Square Brewery in Manhatten, Brewer Tim brings a good sense of what beers people enjoy drinking to Elk Creek Aleworks.  Winning Gold and Bronze medals for his Porter and Bitter at the prestigous Great American Beer Festival attests to the fact that his peers also think he makes great beer. Drawing inspiration primarily from traditional English ale brewing, Tim makes balanced beers, giving both malt and hops prominence in every pint.  In addition to our rotating selection of seasonal brews, we offer six outstanding House Standards year 'round.  Without doubt, there's a pint for you!

data.name: Pogue's Run Porter
data.description: The Flat12 Porter is inspired by the robust porters favored by the Industrial-age working men of Europe. We chose to emphasize balance from a combination of dark grains including brown malt, which was the primary roasted grain of the time. This Flat12 creation is smooth and balanced with slight roast and chocolate notes, yet it's not heavy, just like a good porter should be.

breweries.name: Flat12 Bierwerks
breweries.description:
Flat12 Bierwerks is a production craft brewery based in downtown Indianapolis, USA. Flat12 brews beers for quality, consistency and tradition - with a twist. Our classic line-up includes the Upside Down Blonde, Half Cycle IPA, Pogue's Run Porter and Flat12 Amber Ale. Specialties and seasonals will feature herbs, spices and other experimentations, always geared toward flavor, taste and well-orchestrated subtlety. 

Inspiration: The Flathead 12-cylinder engine - a nod to the automotive and craft brewing heritage of our neighborhood and the early 1900s era when both thrived.

breweries.name: ZwanzigZ Pizza & Brewing
breweries.description: ZwanzigZ Brewing is a two and a half year old addition to our independently owned pizzeria that opened in 2002. Located 40 minutes South of Indianapolis in Columbus Indiana. Follow I65 to exit 68 and head 5 minutes to just North of downtown. Nestled in a residential neighborhood, we'll make you feel like home with our fresh made deck oven pizzas, calzones, sandwiches and salads. Enjoy one of our 16 beers on tap including 4 Bourbon Barrel aged beers. In our family dining room, also enjoy any of our four craft sodas.

data.name: Polka King
data.description: A dark brown porter brewed with pale chocolate malts and English hops. It’s a malty beer with notes of roasted chocolate and caramel and is the perfect stepping stone for those looking to venture into the realm of darker beers.

breweries.name: Door County Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
Door County Brewing Company is inspired by our surrounding; our friends, our families, our landscape. Our mission is to create beers that lead to a gathering of community and friends where ever you are. We promise to create only the best tasting, thought provoking, carefully sourced, eco conscience beers that are constantly pushing the edge of imagination and senses.

What you will find in our beers is music, food, friends, family, travel, trees, soils and flowers—not just ingredients.

Our new tasting room has just opened in downtown Silver City serving craft beer, spirits, and fine pub food.

breweries.name: Wasatch Brewery
breweries.description: Wasatch Beers (Schirf Brewing Company) was formed when Greg Schirf found his way to Utah from Milwaukee,America’s beer capital, only todiscover that his newly adopted home state did not have a brewery of its own. Recognizing a need and an opportunity, he committed to rectify this situation. In 1986, Schirf opened the first brewery in the resort town of Park City and named his beers after the majestic Wasatch Mountains that rise just east of Salt Lake City. In July 1989, Schirf Brewing opened its new company headquarters and the first brew pub in Utah at the top of historic Main Street in Park City.

beerVariation.name: Polygamy Porter
beerVariation.description:
This dark, medium bodied ale offers the drink-ability of a much lighter beer. The inviting chocolate and malty flavors fade into a slightly dry, silky smooth finish. Why have just one? 4.0% alcohol by volume.

2008 Silver Medal Winner, Brown Porter, North American Brewers' Association
2008 Silver Medal Winner, Brown Porter, World Beer Cup
2006 Silver Medal Winner, Brown Porter, North American Brewers' Association

breweries.name: Utah Brewers Cooperative
breweries.description:
Wasatch Beers (Schirf Brewing Company) was formed when Greg Schirf found his way to Utah from Milwaukee, America’s beer capital, only to discover that his newly adopted home state did not have a brewery of its own. Recognizing a need and an opportunity, he committed to rectify this situation. In 1986, Schirf opened the first brewery in the resort town of Park City and named his beers after the majestic Wasatch Mountains that rise just east of Salt Lake City. In July 1989, Schirf Brewing opened its new company headquarters and the first brew pub in Utah at the top of historic Main Street in Park City.

In fact, it was Schirf who proposed the bill to the Utah Legislature in 1988 that would make brew pubs legal in Utah. There are now more than 12 thriving brew pubs in the state thanks to Schirf and the bill's sponsor, Senator Mike Demeitrick of Price, Utah.

In 1986, Schirf opened the first brewery in the resort town of Park City and named his beers after the majestic Wasatch Mountains that rise just east of Salt Lake City. In July 1989, Schirf Brewing opened its new company headquarters and the first brew pub in Utah at the top of historic Main Street in Park City.

In fact, it was Schirf who proposed the bill to the Utah Legislature in 1988 that would make brew pubs legal in Utah. There are now more than 12 thriving brew pubs in the state thanks to Schirf and the bill's sponsor, Senator Mike Demeitrick of Price, Utah.

breweries.name: Wasatch Brewery
breweries.description: Wasatch Beers (Schirf Brewing Company) was formed when Greg Schirf found his way to Utah from Milwaukee,America’s beer capital, only todiscover that his newly adopted home state did not have a brewery of its own. Recognizing a need and an opportunity, he committed to rectify this situation. In 1986, Schirf opened the first brewery in the resort town of Park City and named his beers after the majestic Wasatch Mountains that rise just east of Salt Lake City. In July 1989, Schirf Brewing opened its new company headquarters and the first brew pub in Utah at the top of historic Main Street in Park City.

breweries.name: Denizens Brewing Co
breweries.description: Denizens Brewing Co. is a craft brewery serving European-style lagers, American-style ales, Belgian-inspired beers, sour beers, and barrel-aged beers to both the craft beer aficionado and those new to high quality brews. The brewery, along with our 200-seat beer garden and 2-level taproom, are located steps from the Metro in downtown Silver Spring.

breweries.name: Arvada Beer Company
breweries.description:
Arvada Beer Company is located in Olde Town Arvada, CO. Arvada Beer Company is the first Micro Brewery in the city of Arvada.

Arvada Beer Company is considered a “micro-brewery”, which produces beer that is wholesaled to pubs, taverns and restaurants in the city of Arvada, throughout Jefferson County, and  to the broader regional market.

Our tasting room allows you to view the operation of the brewery, purchase beer by the glass, growlers and kegs of beer to go, and retail items such as T-shirts and glassware with our logo.

Arvada Beer Company is different than most microbreweries due to our large tasting room. We have approximately 150 seats.

We have 14 taps that allow us to have specialty beers as well as our flagship beers on tap at all times.

Arvada Beer Company produces beer with a 7-barrel, stainless steel brewing plant.

data.name: Poop Deck Porter
data.description:
Ahoy you Scurvy Dogs!

-PDP is our house porter aged on black rum-soaked oak chips.

-A blend of rich, roasted malts, vanilla, oak, toasted coconut and dark molasses flavors will make you shiver your timbers.

-ARRRRRRRRRRR!

breweries.name: Flat12 Bierwerks
breweries.description:
Flat12 Bierwerks is a production craft brewery based in downtown Indianapolis, USA. Flat12 brews beers for quality, consistency and tradition - with a twist. Our classic line-up includes the Upside Down Blonde, Half Cycle IPA, Pogue's Run Porter and Flat12 Amber Ale. Specialties and seasonals will feature herbs, spices and other experimentations, always geared toward flavor, taste and well-orchestrated subtlety. 

Inspiration: The Flathead 12-cylinder engine - a nod to the automotive and craft brewing heritage of our neighborhood and the early 1900s era when both thrived.

breweries.name: Brouwerij Sterkens
breweries.description:
Until 1990, the brewery mainly distributed its beers to over 500 restaurants and pubs in Belgium. In the past 15 years, however, the brewery has increasingly shifted its focus to the export market and at present, some 95% of production is sold abroad.

The distinct packaging in ceramic crocks and ornamental bottles have given the beers of the Sterkens Brewery a unique image. That is why we have satisfied customers and appreciating beer lovers in more than 30 countries on the 5 continents

breweries.name: Northwoods Brewpub and Grill
breweries.description:
Northwoods Brewpub and Grill brought the fine tradition of craft brewing to Eau Claire. Now the first microbrewery in west central Wisconsin is the place to be!

It’s all woodsy and warm in our lodge-like bar. Hang out with friends, shoot pool for free or melt into the comfy chairs in the lounge. Whether you want to let loose, play trivia or have an intimate conversation there’s a spot waiting for you. Did we mention the 14 tap beers? Your thirst stops here.

breweries.name: Lumina Brewing Company
breweries.description: Lumina Brewing Company is dedicated to producing beer in small batches. We brew our beer right on premises. All of our beer is fresh with no preservatives. We specialize in brewing German and Bohemian Style Beer. We brew our European Style beer in accordance with the Bavarian Brewing Tradition of “Reinheitsgebot”, the German beer purity law of 1516. This means that nothing is added to the beer except yeast, hops, water and grain. All of our Bavarian Style Beer contains malt and hops from Germany. Our Brew masters have extensively traveled Germany and the Czech Republic and have visited many breweries to learn the art of old world style brewing.

breweries.name: MadTree Brewing Company
breweries.description:
MadTree Brewing Company was started by three self-proclaimed “maniac” homebrewers and aspiring entrepreneurs who believe strongly in the creation of beers that stand up to the best craft brews across the country.
Along with that vision they put their own “mad twists” on their creations. The MadTree approach is simple – create high quality beer, educate the consumer, run a responsible business, and support the local communities.
MadTree engages local artists and craftspeople for their marketing materials, can designs, tap handles and furniture. Many of these efforts have received local and national recognition.

HIGHLIGHTS
- The trio quit their corporate jobs in 2012/2013 and in January 2013 they brewed their first commercial batch.
- In April they opened their taproom and became the first modern craft brewery to can their beer in the state of Ohio.
- Draft Magazine rated PsycHOPathy IPA a 97/100, the second best score for an IPA reviewed by Draft Magazine.
- PsycHOPathy IPA was named as one of the “Six New Craft Can Designs That Belong in an Art Gallery” by craftcans.com

breweries.name: Port Townsend Brewing Company
breweries.description: The original Port Townsend Brewing Company was one of the largest and longest operating breweries of its time. It was capitalized at $25,000 and established September 5, 1905 by George Watkins, Michael Hartman and N.W. O'Rear. Ernest Studerus, a well-known citizen at the time, served as brewmaster. The site of the old brewery was on the west side of Monroe Street between Water and Washington Street which now houses the Athletic Club.

data.name: Portage
data.description: A great porter just feels right in your hand. And carrying a glass of Portage Porter is no different. An opaque, brown pour, this beer presents with coffee and chocolate aromas, with hints of toast and smoked almonds. The taste follows suit, adding an upfront sweetness and a slight, roasty bitterness to back it up. Creamy and wonderful, this porter sips a medium body and finishes dry and delightful. Portage Porter carts itself towards perfection. Just tip your glass and keep smiling. Available January 2015.

breweries.name: New Belgium Brewing
breweries.description: We'll set the scene: 1989. Belgium. Boy on bike. (OK, make that a young man of 32). As our aspiring young homebrewer rides his mountain bike with fat tires through European villages famous for beer, New Belgium Brewing Company was but a glimmer in his eye. Or basement. For Jeff Lebesch would return to Fort Collins with a handful of ingredients and an imagination full of recipes. And then there was beer. Jeff's first two basement-brewed creations? A brown dubbel with earthy undertones named Abbey and a remarkably well-balanced amber he named Fat Tire. To say the rest was history would be to overlook his wife's involvement. Kim Jordan was New Belgium's first bottler, sales rep, distributor, marketer and financial planner. And now, she's our CEO.

breweries.name: Moor Beer Company
breweries.description:
Moor Beer Company brings you something different – a company dedicated to quality products, service to the community and social responsibility. We are not publicly traded and leave our accountability to the people that matter – our customers, employees, suppliers and families.

We strive to produce strongly flavoured beers of exceptional character. All our beers are brewed using only natural ingredients. We put a lot into our beers by using the finest malt, hops, yeast and water – but don’t take anything out. All our beers are unfiltered so they retain the yeast that is so vital to producing exceptional flavour, as well as providing vitamins.

data.description: Chocolate notes with a secret ingredient. What is it?

breweries.name: Crux Fermentation Project
breweries.description:
Crux brewmaster Larry Sidor is always in pursuit of the next great beer—beer that defies taste profiles with its complexity and creativity. We’ve designed our brewery to allow for non-traditional brewing methods like decoction mashing, open fermentation, oak barrel aging, wild yeast strains and experimental hops.

Initially, we’ll only have a few thousand hectoliters of capacity. With added fermenters and bright beer tanks, we could push that to 11,000 hectoliters (or around 9,000 barrels). But we kinda like being small. It makes us nimble and free to experiment in ways that just aren’t possible with larger batch sizes.

Housed in a former transmission shop and mill supply store, Crux Fermentation Project was built by a community of beer lovers. To everyone who contributed ideas, materials, sweat and support, thank you. And cheers.

data.name: Porter
data.description: Hearty malts meld with a subtle balance of hops to create a dark and nurturing ale of comfort and complexity. Hints of bittersweet chocolate and espresso fill the tongue, finishing with just a touch of smoke. Not too sweet or filling, this versatile dark ale dissuades the notion that a darker beer is a stronger beer. Five varieties of roasted malts are the source of Porter’s dark color and rich taste, while two varieties of hops bring a mellow bite to this deep toasty ale.
data.foodPairings: slow-cooked meats, blackened fish, grilled cheese, smoked sausage, chocolate desserts,pumpkin pie, cheesecake

breweries.name: Southern Tier Brewing Company
breweries.description: Southern Tier Brewing Company was founded in 2004 by Phineas DeMink and Allen Yahn with the vision of bringing small batch brewing back to a region rich in brewing tradition. In 2003 Skip and Phin purchased the defunct Old Saddle Back Brewing Co. in Pittsfield, Massachusetts. All the equipment was removed and brought back to Lakewood, New York and set up at its new 10,000 square foot home, The Southern Tier Brewing Company. The Brewery began operations in February 2004 distributing regionally. By 2005 sales covered the majority of the New York State and the eastern half of Pennsylvania. In the beginning their two Flagship brands were a Pilsner and Mild Ale. Oh yeah they also brewed IPA! As it turned out the flagships were a flop and the IPA was a huge success. They next launched a line of seasonal beers which have gained great success. Since the beginning, Southern Tier has experienced steady growth, currently distributing to over 25% of the United States. Multiple expansions have been made to keep up with demand and the brewery continues to be innovative by producing new products.  Keep a look out for new products coming to stores near you.

breweries.name: Hi-Fi Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
The needle first dropped into the groove in 2009, when John and Ryan bumped into each other at the Craft Brewers Conference. They were members of the same homebrew club back home (the Mt. Si Brewing Society in Snoqualmie – no rules, no dues, just beer), but hadn’t realized that they shared a dream to “go pro.”

Upon his return from that conference, John started riffing on a business plan, and eventually turned up the volume to include his wife Cathy, Ryan, and fellow Mt. Si club member Joe.

After a few meetings, we found our resonant frequency as a group: an honest, straightforward approach to beer and to business.

The name Hi-Fi Brewing is a reflection of that approach. We maintain a high level of fidelity to our customers, our suppliers, our employees, and our beer.

breweries.name: Bell's Brewery, Inc.
breweries.description: Bell's Brewery, Inc. began in 1985 with a quest for better beer and a 15 gallon soup kettle. Since then, we've grown into a regional craft brewery that employs more than 200 people over an 20 state area, in addition to Puerto Rico and Washington DC. The dedication to brewing flavorful, unfiltered, quality craft beers that started in 1985 is still with us today. We currently brew over 20 beers for distribution as well as many other small batch beers that are served at our pub in Kalamazoo, the Eccentric Cafe. Our ongoing goal is to brew thoughtfully, creatively and artistically. We strive to bring an authentic and pleasant experience to all of our customers through our unique ales and beers.
